question.title: Duplicate Emails
question.content:
Write a SQL query to find all duplicate emails in a table named Person.

+----+---------+
| Id | Email   |
+----+---------+
| 1  | a@b.com |
| 2  | c@d.com |
| 3  | a@b.com |
+----+---------+
For example, your query should return the following for the above table:

+---------+
| Email   |
+---------+
| a@b.com |
+---------+

rephrased.body: Given a table named `Person` with columns `Id` (integer) and `Email` (string), write a SQL query to find and return all duplicate emails. The result should be a table with a single column named `Email` containing only the duplicate email addresses.

testcases.explanation: The email 'a@b.com' appears twice in the input table, therefore it is a duplicate and should be returned.
No email address appears more than once in the input table. Therefore, the result set is empty.
The email 'a@b.com' appears multiple times. Only one instance of 'a@b.com' should appear in the result.
